<!-- **Are you in the right place?**
1. For issues or feature requests, please create an issue in this repository.
2. For general technical and non-technical questions, we are happy to help you on our [Rook.io Slack](https://slack.rook.io/).
3. Did you already search the existing open issues for anything similar? -->

**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**
[Ship](https://github.com/replicatedhq/ship) fails because:
1. there is no `values.yaml` file (only a template)
2. `values.yaml.tmpl` contains a field `tag: %%VERSION%%` which does not work out-of-the-box for Helm nor Ship

**Expected behavior:**
The Helm Chart Repo should yield a working Helm Chart (hence usable with Ship as well) out-of-the-box.

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
<!-- Please let us know any circumstances for reproduction of your bug. -->
When running
```
ship init https://github.com/rook/rook/tree/v1.0.0/cluster/charts/rook-ceph
```

See https://github.com/replicatedhq/ship/issues/930 and https://github.com/replicatedhq/ship/issues/931#issuecomment-491439846 .

Ship is an awesome tool to automatically create *kustomizations* from upstream helm charts. The big advantage is that users don't need to fork the helm chart to make adjustments and can rely on updates from the upstream helm chart.

To make this work, it would be great if the helm chart would conform to the standard (i.e. work out-of-the-box without manual efforts, that is cloning repo, renaming values.yaml.tmpl and adding a version tag).

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): n/a
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): n/a
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: n/a
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): n/a
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): n/a
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): n/a
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)): n/a
title: Non-standard Helm Chart prevents usage with Ship
